Sequence Information.Peptide Name: DMS-PS1 (Dermaseptin; XXA; UCLL1c; natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals)
Sequence Information.Source: Skin secretion, the waxy monkey leaf frog or waxy monkey tree frog,Phyllomedusa sauvagei, Argentina, Bolivia, Paraguay and Brazil, South America

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (96.43%) toDermaseptin-S7V=L=G=N=11%; K: 14%; A:18%; Mol formula:  C131H219N34O37S1; Mol Wt: 2932.429; Mol Ex Coeff: 5550; GRAVY: 0.0357.Activity:  active against S. aureus NCTC 10788 (MIC 16 ug/ml), MRSA NCTC 12493 (MIC 64 ug/ml), MRSA (ATCC 43300) (MIC 32 ug/ml), C. albicans NCYC 1467 (MIC 32 ug/ml), E. coli (NCTC 10418) (MIC 16 ug/ml), and P. aeruginosa (ATCC 27853) (MIC 64 ug/ml). Also biofilm inhibition and disruption properties (S. aureus MBIC 32 ug/ml; MBEC 128 ug/ml; E. coli MBIC 16 ug/ml; MBEC >512 ug/ml; P. aeruginosa  MBIC 256 ug/ml; MBEC >512 ug/ml).
Literature Information.Author: Song X, Pan H, Wang H, Liao X, Sun D, Xu K, Chen T, Zhang X, Wu M, Wu D, Gao Y.2020
Literature Information.Title: Identification of new dermaseptins with self-assembly tendency: membrane disruption, biofilm eradication, and infected wound healing efficacy.
